title: Mansion Global Daily: Waterside in Sydney, New Homes Sales Jump in the U.S. and More
text:
Sydney’s Prestigious Waterside Properties Have Rewarded Investors

Healthy demand is driving up prices of the Australian city’s waterside properties. Read More

BY THE NUMBERS

TRENDING TODAY

LISTING OF THE DAY

A Modern Mansion in Washington, D.C., Inspired by Old-World Italian Design

The newly built Palazzo della Felicita features imported design materials and myriad amenities. Read More

NEIGHBORHOOD NOTES

Cultural Riches and Traditional Architecture in Kyoto’s Kamigyo Ward

Peaceful streets, Shinto shrines and Buddhist temples recall the city’s centuries-old heritage. Read More

NEWS BITES

Hong Kong Development Offers Farmland as Government Plans to Seize Private Land Henderson Land Development, Hong Kong’s third-largest landowner, offered three plots of Fanling farmland, totaling 1 million square feet, to be used for public homes if the government plans to act upon the Lands Resumption Ordinance and seize the land in the Northern New Territories. The government recently announced its plans to reclaim 68 hectares to build 21,000 new homes on private farmland. South China Morning Post

U.S. New Home Sales Jump in August Sales of newly built single-family homes in the U.S. rose month-over-month by 7.1% in August with a total of 713,000 units sold, according to the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development. New home sales are 6.4% higher year-over-year than in 2018 due to job growth and lower interest rates. World Property Journal

New Home Trade-In Platforms Like Knock Continue to Emerge Knock is one of the new real estate technology companies set on revolutionizing the real estate industry by allowing those in the market to buy and sell at once through a home trade-in platform. As investors pour billions of dollars into the development of online real estate platforms, the industry is expected to undergo great change, as there are over 100 million active users each month on Trulia and Zillow, said Charles Folsom, Knock’s director of customer service. MarketWatch

U.S. Rental Vacancy Rate Remains Flat in Third Quarter The U.S. apartment vacancy rate remained stagnant year-over-year in the third quarter at 4.7%, according to real estate research firm Reis, Inc. Vacancies rose in 23 out of the 79 major cities. The demand for apartment rentals is expected to remain consistent as the housing market will bear the brunt of any uncertainty, Reis said. Business Times

AROUND NEWS CORP

Candy Spelling Selling Beachfront Malibu Home for $23 Million [The Wall Street Journal]

Home Views: The Website Ranking the Best and Worst Developments in the UK [The Times of London]

Brooklyn House Listed for 50 Times More Than Owners Paid [New York Post]

Bless! Converted Church From 1873 Is This Week's Most Popular Home [realtor.com]
description: Mansion Global’s daily round-up of the latest luxury real estate news from around the world
